intro: Glandularia drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to violet. The plant has glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance and help in reducing water loss. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Glandularia drummondii is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is known for its adaptability to arid environments.
